Headline.Para: Jail, cane for driver who arranged for hitmen to attack uncle's love rival

LeadPara.Para: SINGAPORE - A driver arranged for hitmen to assault his uncle's love rival, and one of the attackers later slashed the victim's face with a penknife, causing permanent disfiguration.
For his role in the conspiracy, Ron Lim De Mai, 26, was jailed for three years, with four strokes of the cane, on Wednesday (March 21).

TailParas.Para: He had schemed with five men and a woman to cause grievous hurt to Mr Joshua Koh Kian Yong, 33, in 2016.
The case began when Ron Lim's uncle, businessman Lim Hong Liang, met Ms Audrey Chen Ying Fang, 26, in 2014, and they soon became an item, said Deputy Public Prosecutor Stephanie Koh.
However, Ms Chen started two-timing Lim Hong Liang with Mr Koh about two years later.
Lim Hong Liang was unhappy when he found out about this affair and told his nephew Ron Lim to make arrangements for Mr Koh to be assaulted.
In mid-April 2016, Ron Lim got to know mover Ong Hock Chye, who said he could get someone to assault Mr Koh. Ong also suggested slashing Mr Koh's face in return for payment.

Ong then contacted Mohammad Amin Aman, his former prison mate, who agreed to do the job. Amin roped in Nur Muhammad Irwan Mohd Ngat, who took along his girlfriend, Nur Atika Fauziana Sherhan, to a meeting with the others.

Amin and Irwan were then given a photograph of Mr Koh. Ron Lim also keyed into Atika's mobile phone the username and password for a Global Positioning System (GPS) account linked to Ms Chen's Mercedes-Benz so that they could track the location of the vehicle.
The court heard that Lim Hong Liang had bought Ms Chen the car and she was unaware that it had been fitted with a GPS that he could track remotely.

On April 29, 2016, Irwan recruited his friend Juhari Ab Karim to help in the attack. After picking up Juhari and Amin in a rented car, Irwan drove to Oasia Hotel Novena, where the Mercedes-Benz was parked.
At about midnight, Ms Chen and Mr Koh left the hotel and went to Huay Kwang Thai Kitchen near Little India for supper.
Irwan, Juhari and Amin tailed the couple in the car.

When the trio reached their destination, Juhari moved in, punched Mr Koh's face and continued to rain blows on him. Irwan came forward with a penknife and slashed Mr Koh's face. The attackers then fled the scene.
DPP Koh said that for their roles in the attack, Ong received $4,500, Juhari $200, and Amin and Irwan each received $2,400. She added that the money was provided by Lim Hong Liang.
Three of Ron Lim's accomplices have been dealt with in court.
Atika, 20, was ordered to undergo reformative training while Juhari, 34, was jailed for 15 months for causing hurt and being a member of an unlawful society.
Irwan, 29, was sentenced to 14.. years' jail and 16 strokes of the cane for drug trafficking and for grievously hurting Mr Koh.
The cases involving Lim Hong Liang, 54, Ong and Amin, both 47, are pending.
Ron Lim pleaded guilty last month. For being part of a conspiracy to commit grievous hurt, he could have been jailed for up to 15 years and fined or caned.
